command: $token=$(az account get-access-token --resource https://graph.microsoft.com --query accessToken -o tsv); $body='{"invitedUserEmailAddress":"nora.chen.personal@gmail.com","invitedUserDisplayName":"Nora Chen","inviteRedirectUrl":"https://portal.azure.com/","sendInvitationMessage":false}'; Invoke-RestMethod -Method POST -Uri "https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/invitations" -Headers @{Authorization="Bearer $token";'Content-Type'='application/json'} -Body $body | ConvertTo-Json
explanation: Creates a guest account via invitation without sending an email, establishing an external-looking persona inside the tenant.
rationale_steps: Acquire a Graph token from Azure CLI for authenticated requests.
Post to the invitations endpoint to create a B2B guest silently.
Return the invitation resource as JSON for automation.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper PowerShell syntax, balanced quotes, correct variable assignments, appropriate method calls, and proper parameter formatting.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1585 (Establish Accounts) by using Microsoft Graph API to create a guest account in Azure AD without sending a notification email, effectively establishing an external persona inside the tenant.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct Powershell syntax for variable assignment, command chaining, cmdlet parameters, and hash table creation for headers.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command accurately leverages Azure CLI for token acquisition and Powershell's Invoke-RestMethod to call the Microsoft Graph API's invitations endpoint, directly fulfilling the intent of creating a guest account without sending an invitation email.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell is well-formed with balanced quotes, correct command separators, valid hashtable headers, and proper token substitution.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It correctly uses Microsoft Graph invitations to create a guest user without sending an email, but it requires appropriate directory invite permissions and Graph consent, contradicting the 'Privilege: None' claim.
